item.title: Jarvis Cocker to release book on British folk clubs
item.description: 'Singing From The Floor' by JP Bean is the Pulp frontman's first acquisition as Editor-at-Large at Faber and Faber

item.title: Paul Weller to perform Record Store Day instore in London
item.description: The Modfather will play Rough Trade East on April 20

item.title: Ozzy Osbourne admits he has been drinking and taking drugs for past 18 months
item.description: Iconic frontman reveals he is is now sober again and says he was "an asshole"

item.title: Grizzly Bear, British Sea Power, John Grant, James Skelly added to Latitude line-up
item.description: Richard Thompson, Tim Burgess, Austra and Ed Harcourt are just some of the latest additions to the Suffolk bash

item.title: Yuck frontman Daniel Blumberg leaves band
item.description: Frontman leaves London grunge rockers behind to focus on solo project

item.title: Miles Kane reveals the small venue which inspired Last Shadow Puppets song
item.description: Singer wrote 'The Meeting Place' with Alex Turner about Liverpool venue

item.title: Shakira sued for £65m damages by ex-boyfriend
item.description: Antonio de la Rua claims he talked the singer to recording her hit 'Hips Don't Lie'

item.title: Tom Cruise to star in sci-fi film based on Japanese 'Yukikaze' novels
item.description: He'll star as a fighter pilot battling to protect the human race from an alien invasion

item.title: Peter Howson's David Bowie portraits to go up for auction
item.description: Ten head studies of the music legend from 1994 will be sold in Glasgow

item.title: Business Secretary Vince Cable says he didn't mean to attack One Direction
item.description: Politician clarifies comments after branding the band's salaries as "immoral"

item.title: 'Breaking Bad' creator on spin-off show: 'I would love to see that happen'
item.description: The spin-off would focus on Saul Goodman, the dodgy lawyer played by Bob Odenkirk

item.title: Channel 5 to make documentary about 'sexting'
item.description: The programme promises to offer a "lighthearted" look at the pastime and will air over the summer

item.title: Drake unveils new track 'Girls Love Beyoncé' – listen
item.description: Track features the chorus of Destiny's Child's 'Say My Name'

item.title: Plan B, Goldfrapp, Azealia Banks, Jurassic 5 for Lovebox festival – ticket details
item.description: The festival takes place July 19-21 in Victoria Park, London

item.title: Disclosure to release debut album in June
item.description: The duo performed with Jessie Ware over the weekend at Coachella Festival in California

item.title: Bon Iver's Justin Vernon records track with Poliça – listen
item.description: They performed 'Tiff' together at Coachella Festival over the weekend

item.title: James Blake announces UK autumn tour - ticket details
item.description: The singer/producer will play six shows including London's O2 Shepherd's Bush Empire in September

item.title: The National unveil trailer for 'Mistaken For Strangers' tour documentary – watch
item.description: The band also add two extra dates their UK and Ireland tour this November

item.title: Pharrell Williams on Daft Punk: 'You don't need MDMA for this music'
item.description: Singer and producer speaks about working with French duo on new album 'Random Access Memories'

item.title: Red Hot Chili Peppers play in a sandstorm to bring Coachella to a close
item.description: Vampire Weekend, Wu-Tang Clan and Grimes perform as sandstorms hit Day Three of US festival

item.title: 'We're ignoring the best new music in the UK', says Steve Lamacq
item.description: DJ says the music industry needs to look outside of London more to find new talent

item.title: Diiv cancel European tour including Great Escape and Primavera appearances
item.description: Zachary Cole Smith says he needs to be off the road to concentrate on band's second album

item.title: Rage Against The Machine chart hijackers accuse BBC of "weakness" over 'Ding Dong!' song
item.description: Jon Morter slams the corporation

item.title: Abba to write theme for Eurovision Song Contest
item.description: 'We Write the Story' will be performed at this year's event in Sweden on May 18

item.title: Keith Richards joins Eric Clapton onstage at Madison Square Garden
item.description: Rolling Stones guitarist makes appearance in New York at Crossroads Festival
